metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34552 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Pillow through 8.2.0 and PIL (aka Python Imaging Library) through 1.1.7 allow an attacker to pass controlled parameters directly into a convert function to trigger a buffer overflow in Convert.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> limited to a DoS only because of FORTIFY_SOURCE

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.5').
pillow-python2 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
